title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 8.3 - Exceptions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 8.3 - Exceptions

State Regulations

Notwithstanding the provisions of section
8.2
of this Part, a road test
shall not be waived if the applicant: (a) has failed a road test in New York within
the last year; (b) has been
licensed in his prior jurisdiction of residence for less than six months, unless such applicant is the holder of a valid commercial driver's license that
has been issued by another state or the District of Columbia; (c) has any physical or mental disability
which, in the discretion of the license examiner, warrants reexamination of
driving ability; or
(d) is applying
for a license which permits the operation of a class of vehicles which the
applicant's previous license did not specifically cover unless a waiver of road
test is specifically provided for by statute or by any other regulations of the
commissioner. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
8.3

Amended, New

York State Register August 27, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 34, eff. 8/27/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
